item.title: Fayerabend: The Last Savior of Science
item.description: Introduction Critics of Feyerabend all follow patterns of behavior undeniably similar to each other. No matter which way they turn, a simple extension of their logic regresses to the beginning of Feyerabend’s argument. In no other criticism is this more apparent than in Chalmers’ “middle lane” counterargument. When drawn to its conclusions, we see that Chalmers puts himself in a double bind. If he wishes to end anarchism, Chalmers must make dogmatic claims which stand at the beginning of Feyerabend’s normative arguments.
